main event: On 2 January 1959, a couple in Huntsville, Alabama, reported observing a UFO. The object was described as a green ball rapidly accelerating and making a turnaround, eventually turning greenish, with no observed dropouts. The conclusions pointed to the object probably being a balloon.
interesting points: The UFO observation lasted for 3 minutes and was reported as ground-radar type.
The report was forwarded to the Rocket City Astronomical Association and the Continental Army Command, Fort Monroe, Virginia.
The findings were investigated by the 29th Army and the Continental Army Command, and no investigative action was taken by Headquarters 25th Air Division.
Observations of an unidentified object on 2 January 1958 included details such as the object's brightness, size, duration, and coordinates.
The Smithsonian Institution Astrophysical Observatory mentioned a case in Huntsville, Alabama, which was concluded to be a meteor, but further interrogation was planned.
